entry.title: Wall Street Journal Holiday Guide Features Sustainable Threads
entry.summary:
Sustainable Threads Auburn Napkin Set is featured in Wall Street Journal Guide for Holiday Gifts.

More
entry.content:
We are excited that our Artisan-woven Auburn Napkins have been selected
and showcased in this years Wall Street Journal Guide for Holiday Gifts. 

Non-Boring Napkins

Any serious host needs napkins, but not more boring napkins. This set, representing a range of reds that darken from a brilliant scarlet to a brooding crimson, adds subtle variation to a tablescape without abandoning utility. The cotton textile, made in Eastern India on bamboo looms, is super-absorbent and machine washable. Now if only every dinner conversation could be as easy and interesting. Handwoven Gradient Cotton Napkins, $45 for 4, food52.com

More
entry.content:
We were featured again on the trendy LDBInteriorTextiles.com pages in their Jan 2019 issue. Our brand new hand block printed cotton place mat, Cerulean, and hand block printed cotton napkin, Cheerful (Aqua,) caught their discerning eye, not just for its chic look, but also for its sustainability aspect. We were featured in their "Show Preview" article for N.Y. Home Textiles Market, Feb. 3 to 6, 2019. We are appreciative of this recognition. 

Hand-Blocked Beauty
Geometric patterns are hand stamped using hand-carved wood blocks and low-impact dyes on Kora (unbleached) cotton to create these placemats and napkins. Offered in sets of four, the napkins and placemats each measure 14 by 20 inches. The designs are handmade by a women’s self-help group from western India. This work is an important avenue for the financial and social regeneration of families displaced when a national park was created on their land. Sustainable Threads, 732-940-7487, sustainablethreads.com

More

LDBInteriorTextiles.com, a leading home decor trade magazine featured Sustainable Threads’ banana bark (stem) placemat in their article on new products on display at the N.Y. Home Textiles Market, Winter 2018. 

Hand-woven 13- by 19-inch placemats and 13- by 72-inch runners are made with natural materials, including banana bark, river grass and cotton. entry.title: Recipient of Sustainability Award
entry.summary:
Thank you judges!

We were honored to be selected for the respectable Sustainability Award, bestowed at the NY Now, Summer 2017 show.

More
entry.content:
DISPLAY AWARDS AT NY NOW
Recognition for new and sustainable products 
NY NOW®, the Market for Home, Lifestyle + Gift, picked winners of two awards programs that result directly from the exhibitors chosen to participate in NY NOW’s popular sustainability: design for a better world® and destination: new product displays - the Eco Choice Awards and the Best Exclusive Launch Award.

Sustainable Threads proudly won in the "Most Sensitive Use of Materials" category, in the Summer 2017 market, for our Biscotti Strawberry placemat, handwoven from banana stem. We are honored to win this adulation; it makes us work harder to continue sourcing eco-friendly materials and design goods to incorporate sustainability every step of the way!
